revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Male Reproductive Organs in Cartilaginous Fishes
tldr: The author examines the male reproductive organs of various cartilaginous fishes, including the Torpedo, Thornback, and common Skate, and provides detailed descriptions of their testes, epididymides, and vas deferens. The study also includes microscopic observations of the fluids within these organs, revealing the presence of animalcules and other cellular structures.
